snippet: The owner of the Towne Crier, which has hosted established musicians and nurtured emerging ones for four decades, says he is taking things day by day.
abstract: Fate of the Towne Crier, music club in Pawling that has nurtured emerging artists and engaged established ones for 40 years, remains uncertain while owner Phil Ciganer weighs decision of whether or not to close it; Ciganer considered closing club in February due to difficulties with finances and his lease, but popular outcry convinced him to consider other options (Metropolitan/Westchester).
lead_paragraph: The owner of the Towne Crier, which has hosted established musicians and nurtured emerging ones for four decades, says he is taking things day by day.

headline.seo: The Towne Crier in Dutchess County Is at a Crossroads
headline.main: Mainstay for Music, Trying Not to Leave
headline.print_headline: Mainstay For Music, Trying Not To Leave
